remarks: The indexed union of a function's values is the union of its image under the index class. Note:  This theorem depends on the fact that our function value is the empty set outside of its domain.  If the antecedent is changed to ` F Fn A ` , the theorem can be proved without this dependency. (Contributed by NM, 26-Mar-2006.)  (Proof shortened by Mario Carneiro, 31-Aug-2015.)
